article.title: Northrop Grumman to Equip Directional Infrared Countermeasures System Onboard Marine Corps Helicopters
article.author: Katie Packard
article.text: Northrop Grumman Corporation has received separate contracts, which have a combined value of approximately $13.3 million, to outfit U.S. Marine Corps CH-53D and CH-46E helicopters with the company's battle-proven Directional Infrared Countermeasures (DIRCM) system.
